transcripts.text: Straw man fallacy.  A straw man fallacy is where one exaggerates someone's argument and uses this exaggeration as a way of disproving one's original argument without actually paying attention to the original argument raised.  Here's an example.  I think we should legalize the use of cannabis.  Well cannabis is a drug so no we should not legalize drugs.  Drugs are dangerous and the legalization of drugs would lead to a lot of problems.  So the original argument was for the legalization of cannabis.  However, this was exaggerated to the legalization of all drugs and this exaggeration was used to argue against the original claim.  The reason it's called a straw man is because it's a fake argument or a straw man which was held up and knocked down as opposed to arguing against the actual argument being put forward.  Interesting.  Okay, I would like to discuss...
